threat: A remote attacker could use this issue to cause OpenSSL to crash, resulting in a denial of service.
A remote attacker could use this issue to cause OpenSSL to consume memory, resulting in a denial of service.
A remote attacker could use this issue to cause OpenSSL to leak memory, resulting in a denial of service.
When OpenSSL is used with certain applications, an attacker may use this issue to possibly gain access to sensitive information.
If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be used to force a protocol downgrade to TLS 1.0.
A remote attacker could use this with applications that use SRP to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.
special:
The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:
After a standard system update you need to reboot your computer to make
all the necessary changes.
